meaningMnemonic:
What does <kanji>Italy</kanji> <kanji>attain</kanji> like no other? <vocabulary>Flamboyance</vocabulary>! They redefine <vocabulary>chic</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>stylishness</vocabulary>, dazzling everyone with their unabashed display.

This word isn’t just about fashion; it's also for flamboyant, attention-grabbing actions. While it's an old-fashioned word, you still find it in phrases like 伊達眼鏡 (fashion glasses) or 伊達に〜はしていない (not doing something for show).
readingMnemonic:
The readings for both kanji are ones you haven't seen before. So here's a mnemonic to help you remember:

So how does Italy attain its <vocabulary>flamboyance</vocabulary>? Because it embodies <reading>Da</reading>n<reading>te</reading>’s (だて) bold essence—vibrant, captivating, and <vocabulary>chic</vocabulary> in every way. In Italy, Dante's influence is a living testament to flamboyant elegance.
